title: Informational Ontology — Master (Rev5+)
note: This page is a web-readable guide to the Master. Downloads remain on /papers.

sections.title: Preface and Scope Discipline
sections.lay: Plain-language orientation and what the Master is (and isn’t).

sections.title: The Regime Chain (Δ → R → I → A → V → M → P)
sections.lay: A high-level explanation of the regime sequence and what each stage does.

sections.title: Core Definitions and Commitments
sections.lay: The minimal commitments the ontology makes, and how to read its claims.

sections.title: Systems, Boundaries, and Re-Identifiability
sections.lay: How systems are carved, tracked, and re-identified without substance metaphysics.

sections.title: Constraint, Ordering, and Direction
sections.lay: How constraints structure trajectories and generate directionality.

sections.title: Meaning Without Semantics
sections.lay: Meaning as structural stabilization, not truth-conditional representation.

sections.title: Agency and Perspective-Induced Openness
sections.lay: Agency as underdetermination in embedded perspectives.

sections.title: Ethics and Responsibility as Constraint Regimes
sections.lay: Ethics and responsibility as emergent coordination constraints.

sections.title: Appendices and Worked Examples
sections.lay: Examples and clarifications that support the main text.
